page.title: 08Yetholm primary School (2)
page.content: An expensive modernisation scheme for Yetholm School first proposed in the 1940's, delayed at least ten times is to start in 1987. A radical reduction in the number of Primary Schools in the Borders threatened the existence of the school. An amalgamation with Morebattle, a continual threat, was considered but after review firmly rejected. This issue aroused great passion in the village with parents, and Community Councillors mounting an effective campaign to save the school. {WAUCHOPE HALL:-}Administered by trustees, the hall in the last 10 years has had a new heating system, re-decoration and a balcony removed. A focal point in the community the hall is used by all groups. {LIBRARY:-}An average of 40 people exchange thier books at the library, held in the school, 3 evenings a week.
